content: Insurance Asked by AnonymousAsked on 27 Nov 2018Should I keep my WL policy bought by my parents when I was young?I'm a 23-year-old female who just started working. I have existing WL, medical and personal accident policies bought by my parents when I was young. I intend to keep the medical and personal accident but I'm uncertain if I should keep the WL. The annual premium for the WL is $547 for 50k coverage. Should I keep this policy and top up with a term insurance? Or should I surrender and buy a term insurance instead? On top of this dilemma, I'm also keen on getting a critical illness insurance.5 answersAnswerBump0

Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 30 Nov 2018Speak to a financial advisor who could provide you with a better assessment whether to keep your whole life policy. Whatever the case, do ensure you are covered for death, TPD, CI and ECI. 0 comments0

Loh Tat TianLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 30 Nov 2018You might want to do a comparison table on the Whole Life you have bought. With that, it is easier to make a deicsion.You can plot the premiums (right from year 1) and compare it with Buy Term, Invest Rest (with CPF-SA or CPF-OA as a benchmark), to find the best time to surrender, withdraw, or maybe just to keep the WL cover.0 comments0

God of WisdomAnswered on 28 Nov 2018Hey Anon, I suggest you take a look at your premium end date and also the current surrender value of the policy.Even if you're not using it for its death benefit, it's still an asset that has a solid 3-4% return per annum.So I would advise against cancelling it. But you should top up your insurance coverage. The rule of thumb is to have about 10 X of your annual income as death coverage and 4-5X as CI coverage. 0 comments0

Yixiong ChangLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 27 Nov 2018Whether to surrender the WL aside, I feel u should still get a Term insurance. Your current coverage is grossly inadequent. For your age, u can get a $400K (death, TPD, and CI) sum assured till age 65, for less than $700 annual premium. What is this medical and personal policies that u have. It should be reviewed and compared with newer polices as well. Newer Personal accident policies could have better terms and coverage. once u have gotten your coverage in place, then u can decide whether to keep the WL. Personally I feel the premium can be better utilitized elsewhere. There are better alternatives to do what the WL would be intended to accomplish. Do add me on facebook if u require further detailed discussion. I can only provide a short summary here.0 comments0
